H0.text: The current climate is studied by scientists to conclude that a forested ecosystem existed in Antarctica millions of years ago.

H1.text: The fossil record is what scientists study to conclude that a forested ecosystem existed in Antarctica millions of years ago.

H2.text: Glacial movement is the study that allows scientists to conclude that a forested ecosystem existed in Antarctica millions of years ago.

H3.text: Seafloor spreading is the process studied by scientists to conclude that a forested ecosystem existed in Antarctica millions of years ago.

A4.text: The Fossil Record is a complete listing of the families, orders, class and phyla found in the fossil record
